bird.title: Common Treatments Used by Vets for Birds with Fever
care: Keep the bird warm and in a quiet, stress-free environment
Provide fresh water and high-quality food
Contact an avian veterinarian for proper diagnosis and dosage

finch.title: Common Treatments Used by Vets for Finches with Fever
care: Move to a small hospital cage in a warm, quiet room (26-29°C)
Keep away from drafts and other birds
Provide fresh water and high-quality finch seed mix
Monitor breathing, droppings, and activity closely

hen.title: Common Treatments Used by Vets for Hens with Fever
care: Isolate the hen in a clean, dry, draft-free pen with deep bedding
Check the comb and wattles, breathing, and mobility
Offer a good layer feed and limit heavy treats
Contact a poultry veterinarian within 24 hours

bird.title: Common Treatments Used by Vets for Weak Birds
care: Place in a warm, quiet hospital cage
Offer soft foods and fresh water

finch.title: Common Treatments Used by Vets for Weak Finches
care: Place in a warm, quiet hospital cage
Offer soft foods and fresh water

hen.title: Common Treatments Used by Vets for Weak Hens
care: Isolate in a clean, dry pen
Provide fresh water and nutritious feed

bird.title: Common Treatments Used by Vets for Lethargic Birds
care: Provide nutritious food and clean water

finch.title: Common Treatments Used by Vets for Lethargic Finches
care: Provide nutritious finch food and clean water

hen.title: Common Treatments Used by Vets for Lethargic Hens
care: Provide nutritious feed and clean water

bird.title: Common Treatments Used by Vets for Birds Not Breeding
care: Ensure proper diet with calcium and minerals
Consult an avian veterinarian for breeding advice

finch.title: Common Treatments Used by Vets for Finches Not Breeding
care: Ensure proper diet with calcium and minerals
Consult an avian veterinarian for breeding advice

hen.title: Common Treatments Used by Vets for Hens Not Breeding
care: Ensure proper diet with calcium and minerals
Consult a poultry veterinarian for breeding advice

bird.title: Common Treatments Used by Vets for Digestive Issues in Birds
care: Provide fresh water at all times
Keep the bird warm and stress-free

finch.title: Common Treatments Used by Vets for Digestive Issues in Finches
care: Provide fresh water at all times
Keep the finch warm and stress-free

hen.title: Common Treatments Used by Vets for Digestive Issues in Hens
care: Provide fresh water at all times
Keep the hen warm and stress-free

bird.title: Common Treatments Used by Vets for Viral Infections in Birds
care: Isolate the bird from other birds

finch.title: Common Treatments Used by Vets for Viral Infections in Finches
care: Isolate the finch from other birds

hen.title: Common Treatments Used by Vets for Viral Infections in Hens
care: Isolate the hen from other birds

bird.title: Common Treatments Used by Vets for Stressed Birds

finch.title: Common Treatments Used by Vets for Stressed Finches

hen.title: Common Treatments Used by Vets for Stressed Hens

bird.title: Common Treatments Used by Vets for Mites in Birds
care: Clean and disinfect the entire cage
Spray cage with Dettol water solution
Consult a veterinarian for proper treatment

finch.title: Common Treatments Used by Vets for Mites in Finches
care: Clean and disinfect the entire cage
Spray cage with Dettol water solution
Consult a veterinarian for proper treatment

hen.title: Common Treatments Used by Vets for Mites in Hens
care: Clean and disinfect the entire coop
Spray coop with Dettol water solution
Consult a veterinarian for proper treatment

bird.title: Emergency Treatment for Bleeding Birds
care: EMERGENCY: Stop bleeding immediately with styptic powder or cornstarch
Apply gentle pressure with clean cloth
Isolate in warm, quiet hospital cage
Contact an avian veterinarian IMMEDIATELY - bleeding is life-threatening

finch.title: Emergency Treatment for Bleeding Finches
care: EMERGENCY: Stop bleeding immediately with styptic powder or cornstarch
Apply gentle pressure with clean cloth
Isolate in warm, quiet hospital cage (26-29°C)
Contact an avian veterinarian IMMEDIATELY - bleeding is life-threatening

hen.title: Emergency Treatment for Bleeding Hens
care: EMERGENCY: Stop bleeding immediately with styptic powder or cornstarch
Apply gentle pressure with clean cloth
Isolate in clean, dry pen with deep bedding
Contact a poultry veterinarian IMMEDIATELY - bleeding is life-threatening
